Lemmas: a penetration test colloquially known a a pentest or ethical hacking is an authorized simulated cyberattack on a computer system performed to evaluate the security of the system this is not to be confused with a vulnerability assessment the test is performed to identify weakness or vulnerability including the potential for unauthorized party to gain access to the system feature and data a well a strength enabling a full risk assessment to be completed the process typically identifies the target system and a particular goal then review available information and undertakes various mean to attain that goal a penetration test target may be a white box about which background and system information are provided in advance to the tester or a black box about which only basic information other than the company name is provided a gray box penetration test is a combination of the two where limited knowledge of the target is shared with the auditor a penetration test can help identify a system vulnerability to attack and estimate how vulnerable it issecurity issue that the penetration test uncovers should be reported to the system owner penetration test report may also ass potential impact to the organization and suggest countermeasure to reduce the riskthe uk national cyber security center describes penetration testing a a method for gaining assurance in the security of an it system by attempting to breach some or all of that system security using the same tool and technique a an adversary mightthe goal of a penetration test vary depending on the type of approved activity mitigation strategiespenetration test are a component of a full security audit for example the payment card industry data security standard requires penetration testing on a regular schedule and after system change penetration testing also can support risk assessment a outlined in the nist risk management framework sp standard framework and methodology exist for conducting penetration test these include the open source security testing methodology manual osstmm the penetration testing execution standard ptes the nist special publication the information system security assessment framework Lemmas: biometrics are body measurement and calculation related to human characteristic biometric authentication or realistic authentication is used in computer science a a form of identification and access control it is also used to identify individual in group that are under surveillance biometric identifier are the distinctive measurable characteristic used to label and describe individual biometric identifier are often categorized a physiological characteristic which are related to the shape of the body example include but are not limited to fingerprint palm vein face recognition dna palm print hand geometry iris recognition retina odorscent voice shape of ear and gait behavioral characteristic are related to the pattern of behavior of a person including but not limited to mouse movement typing rhythm gait signature behavioral profiling and voice some researcher have coined the term behaviometrics to describe the latter class of biometricsmore traditional mean of access control include tokenbased identification system such a a driver license or passport and knowledgebased identification system such a a password or personal identification number since biometric identifier are unique to individual they are more reliable in verifying identity than token and knowledgebased method however the collection of biometric identifier raise privacy concern about the ultimate use of this information biometric functionality many different aspect of human physiology chemistry or behavior can be used for biometric authentication the selection of a particular biometric for use in a specific application involves a weighting of several factor jain et al identified seven such factor to be used when assessing the suitability of any trait for use in biometric authentication biometric authentication is based upon biometric recognition which is an advanced method of recognising biological and behavioural characteristic of an individual universality mean that every person using a system should posse the trait uniqueness mean the trait should be sufficiently different for individual in the relevant population such that they can be distinguished from one another permanence relates to the manner in which a trait varies over time more specifically a trait with good permanence will be reasonably invariant over time with respect to the specific matching algorithm measurability collectability relates to the ease of acquisition or measurement of the trait in addition acquired data should be in a form that permit subsequent processing and extraction of the relevant feature set performance relates to the accuracy speed and robustness of technology used see performance section for more detail acceptability relates to how well individual in the relevant population accept the technology such that they are willing to have their biometric trait captured and assessed circumvention relates to the ease with which a trait might be imitated using an artifact or substituteproper biometric use is very application dependent certain biometrics will be better than others based on the required level of convenience and security no single biometric will meet all the requirement of every possible application the block diagram illustrates the two basic mode of a biometric system first in verification or authentication mode the system performs a onetoone comparison of a captured biometric with a specific template stored in a biometric database in order to verify the individual is the person they claim to be three step are involved in the verification of a person in the first step reference model for all the user are generated and stored in the model database in the second step some sample are matched with reference model to generate the genuine and impostor score and calculate the threshold the third step is the testing step this process may use a smart card username or id number eg pin to indicate which template should be used for comparison positive recognition is a common use of the verification mode where the aim is to prevent multiple people from using the same identitysecond in identification mode the system performs a onetomany comparison against a biometric database in an attempt to establish the identity of an unknown individual the system will succeed in identifying the individual if the comparison of the biometric sample to a template in the database fall within a previously set threshold identification mode can be used either for positive recognition so that the user doe not have to provide any information about the template to be used or for negative recognition of the person where the system establishes whether the person is who she implicitly or explicitly denies to be the latter function can only be achieved through biometrics since other method of personal recognition such a password pin or key are ineffective the first time an individual us a biometric system is called enrollment during enrollment biometric information from an individual is captured and stored in subsequent us biometric information is detected and compared with the information stored at the time of enrollment note that it is crucial that storage and retrieval of such system themselves be secure if the biometric system is to be robust the first block sensor is the interface between the real world and the system it ha to acquire all the necessary data most of the time it is an image acquisition system but it can change according to the characteristic desired the second block performs all the necessary preprocessing it ha to remove artifact from the sensor to enhance the input eg removing background noise to use some kind of normalization etc in the third block necessary feature are extracted this step is an important step a the correct feature need to be extracted in an optimal way a vector of number or an image with particular property is used to create a template a template is a synthesis of the relevant characteristic extracted from the source element of the biometric measurement that are not used in the comparison algorithm are discarded in the template to reduce the file size and to protect the identity of the enrollee however depending on the scope of the biometric system original biometric image source may be retained such a the pivcards used in the federal information processing standard personal identity verification piv of federal employee and contractor fips the enrollment phase the template is simply stored somewhere on a card or within a database or both during the matching phase the obtained template is passed to a matcher that compare it with other existing template estimating the distance between them using any algorithm eg hamming distance the matching program will analyze the template with the input this will then be output for a specified use or purpose eg entrance in a restricted area though it is a fear that the use of biometric data may face mission creep selection of biometrics in any practical application depending upon the characteristic measurement and user requirement in selecting a particular biometric factor to consider include performance social acceptability ease of circumvention andor spoofing robustness population coverage size of equipment needed and identity theft deterrence the selection of a biometric is based on user requirement and considers sensor and device availability computational time and reliability cost sensor size and power consumption multimodal biometric system multimodal biometric system use multiple sensor or biometrics to overcome the limitation of unimodal biometric system for instance iris recognition system can be compromised by aging iris and electronic fingerprint recognition can be worsened by wornout or cut fingerprint while unimodal biometric system are limited by the integrity of their identifier it is unlikely that several unimodal system will suffer from identical limitation multimodal biometric system can obtain set of information from the same marker ie multiple image of an iris or scan of the same finger or information from different biometrics requiring fingerprint scan and using voice recognition a spoken passcodemultimodal biometric system can fuse these unimodal system sequentially simultaneously a combination thereof or in series which refer to sequential parallel hierarchical and serial integration mode respectively fusion of the biometrics information can occur at different stage of a recognition system in case of feature level fusion the data itself or the feature extracted from multiple biometrics are fused matchingscore level fusion consolidates the score generated by multiple classifier pertaining to different modality finally in case of decision level fusion the final result of multiple classifier are combined via technique such a majority voting feature level fusion is believed to be more effective than the other level of fusion because the feature set contains richer information about the input biometric data than the matching score or the output decision of a classifier therefore fusion at the feature level is expected to provide better recognition resultsspoof attack consist in submitting fake biometric trait to biometric system and are a major threat that can curtail their security multimodal biometric discriminating power of all biometric technology depend on the amount of entropy they are able to encode and use in matching the following are used a performance metric for biometric system false match rate fmr also called far false accept rate the probability that the system incorrectly match the input pattern to a nonmatching template in the database it measure the percent of invalid input that are incorrectly accepted in case of similarity scale if the person is an imposter in reality but the matching score is higher than the threshold then he is treated a genuine this increase the fmr which thus also depends upon the threshold value false nonmatch rate fnmr also called frr false reject rate the probability that the system fails to detect a match between the input pattern and a matching template in the database it measure the percent of valid input that are incorrectly rejected receiver operating characteristic or relative operating characteristic roc the roc plot is a visual characterization of the tradeoff between the fmr and the fnmr in general the matching algorithm performs a decision based on a threshold that determines how close to a template the input need to be for it to be considered a match if the threshold is reduced there will be fewer false nonmatches but more false accepts conversely a higher threshold will reduce the fmr but increase the fnmr a common variation is the detection error tradeoff det which is obtained using normal deviation scale on both ax this more linear graph illuminates the difference for higher performance rarer error equal error rate or crossover error rate eer or cer the rate at which both acceptance and rejection error are equal the value of the eer can be easily obtained from the roc curve the eer is a quick to find fix and preferably prevent security issue within application it encompasses the whole application life cycle from requirement analysis design implementation verification a well a maintenanceweb application security is a branch of information security that deal specifically with the security of website web application and web service at a high level web application security draw on the principle of application security but applies them specifically to the internet and web systemsweb application security tool are specialized tool for working with http traffic eg web application firewall approach different approach will find different subset of the security vulnerability lurking in an application and are most effective at different time in the software lifecycle they each represent different tradeoff of time effort cost and vulnerability found design review before code is written the application architecture and design can be reviewed for security problem a common technique in this phase is the creation of a threat model whitebox security review or code review this is a security engineer deeply understanding the application through manually reviewing the source code and noticing security flaw through comprehension of the application vulnerability unique to the application can be found blackbox security audit this is only through the use of an application testing it for security vulnerability no source code is required automated tooling many security tool can be automated through inclusion into the development or testing environment example of those are automated dastsast tool that are integrated into code editor or cicd platform coordinated vulnerability platform these are hackerpowered application security solution offered by many website and software developer by which individual can receive recognition and compensation for reporting bug security threat the open web application security project owasp provides free and open resource it is led by a nonprofit called the owasp foundation the owasp top result from recent research based on comprehensive data compiled from over partner organization this data revealed approximately million vulnerability across over application according to the owasp top the ten most critical web application security risk include broken access control cryptographic failure injection insecure design security misconfiguration vulnerable and outdated component identification and authentification failure software and data integrity failure security logging and monitoring failure serverside request forgery ssrf tooling for security testing security testing technique scour for vulnerability or security hole in application these vulnerability leave application open to kind of automated tool for identifying vulnerability in application common tool category used for identifying application vulnerability include static application security testing sast analyzes source code for security vulnerability during an application development compared to dast sast can be utilized even before the application is in an executable state a sast ha access to the full source code it is a whitebox approach this can yield more detailed result but can result in many false positive that need to be manually verified dynamic application security testing dast often called
